prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Metal Bracket The first part to construct is a rectangular metal bracket with two holes on the top edge, used for securing objects together. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0001, 0.0, 0.0] Sketch Create a new sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of several faces, loops, and curves. Face 1 Face 1 is made up of 4 arcs and 2 lines, forming a closed shape. * Loop 1 + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.6513], End Point [0.185, 0.1101] + Arc 1: Start Point [0.185, 0.1101], Mid Point [0.3402, 0.0], End Point [0.4938, 0.1123] + Line 2: Start Point [0.4938, 0.1123], End Point [0.6696, 0.6513] + Arc 2: Start Point [0.6696, 0.6513], Mid Point [0.5752, 0.746], End Point [0.4802, 0.6521] + Arc 3: Start Point [0.4802, 0.6521], Mid Point [0.3338, 0.5408], End Point [0.1893, 0.6545] + Arc 4: Start Point [0.1893, 0.6545], Mid Point [0.093, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.6513] Face 2 A circle centered at [0.0946, 0.6553] with a radius of 0.0268. Face 3 A circle centered at [0.339, 0.1628] with a radius of 0.0687. Face 4 A circle centered at [0.5749, 0.6513] with a radius of 0.0268. Extrusion Extrude the sketch to create a 3D solid with the following properties: * Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0536 * Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body. This will create the rectangular metal bracket part, which has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 m * Width: 0.75 m * Height: 0.0536 m The final shape of this part is a rectangular metal bracket with two holes on the top edge, used for securing objects together.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This part is constructed by creating a new coordinate system, sketching a 2D profile, transforming the 2D sketch into 3D, and extruding the sketch to generate the 3D model. Extrude the sketch, creating a 3D solid with the following properties: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.045 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 * Operation: New Body (creates a new solid body with the extrusion) After following these steps, you will have created a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with four circular holes.
